name: analyze-crispr-genome-editing
title: Analyze CRISPR Genome Editing
description: Analyze CRISPR-Cas9 genome editing results by comparing original and edited sequences
content:
Overview

This application analyzes CRISPR-Cas9 genome editing results by comparing original and edited DNA sequences to identify mutations and assess editing success. It detects substitutions, insertions, deletions, and evaluates on-target editing efficiency.

Features

  • Sequence alignment and mutation detection
  • Identification of substitutions, insertions, and deletions
  • On-target editing assessment
  • Support for homology-directed repair (HDR) analysis
  • Detection of non-homologous end joining (NHEJ) events

Analysis Steps

  • Identify target site in original sequence
  • Align original and edited sequences
  • Detect and categorize mutations
  • Analyze mutations relative to target site
  • Check for repair template incorporation (if provided)
  • Overall editing assessment

Parameters

  • Original Sequence: DNA sequence before CRISPR-Cas9 editing (file or text)
  • Edited Sequence: DNA sequence after CRISPR-Cas9 editing (file or text)
  • Guide RNA: CRISPR guide RNA (crRNA) sequence
  • Repair Template: Optional HDR template sequence
  • Output Directory: Select or create a stash folder for output

Output

The application generates a comprehensive analysis report including identified mutations, on-target editing assessment, and HDR evaluation if applicable.
command: rm -rf prod_apps 2>/dev/null || true && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git prod_apps && python "prod_apps/biomni/genetics/analyze_crispr_genome_editing.py" "${originalSequence}" "${editedSequence}" "${guideRna}" ${repairTemplate} -o "${outputDir}"
